required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HPV Integration and Tumorigenesis of Uterine Cervical Adenocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-omics Study on the Human Papillomavirus Integration and Tumorigenesis of Uterine Cervical Adenocarcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to analyze the multi-omics results between uterine cervical adenocarcinoma patients with and without human papillomavirus (HPV) infections. The multi-omics profiles include genome wide association study (GWAS), whole exome sequencing, analysis of transcriptomics and metabolomics. The HPV integration status is interpreted by GWAS. A comprehensive multi-omics will reveal the role of HPV integration in the molecular mechanism of tumorigenesis and prognosis of uterine cervical adenocarcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: The differences of frequencies of somatic driving mutations will be compared between patients with and without HPV integration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequencies of alteration of RNA expression
secondary_outcome.description: The alteration of patterns of RNA expression, including mRNA, miRNA, and lncRNA, will be compared between patients with and without HPV integration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequencies of alteration of protein expression and signal pathway
secondary_outcome.description: The alteration of patterns of protein expression and signal pathway will be compared between patients with and without HPV integration.
Progression-free survival between patients with differential expressed multi-omics will be compared.

arm_group.description: The HPV integration status will be checked by GWAS.
The HPV integration status will be checked by GWAS.

intervention.description: A multi-omics analysis including genome-wide association study, whole exome sequencing, transcriptomics and metabolomics.

biospec_descr.textblock: An 8 ml peripheral venous blood, and 50 Î¼L cancer tissue and tissue adjacent to cancer will be collected from eligible patients.

study_pop.textblock: All patients confirmed primary adenocarcinoma of the uterine cervix

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed primary adenocarcinoma of the uterine cervix
- Signed an approved informed consents
- Feasible for biopsy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not meeting all of the inclusion criteria

patient_data.ipd_description: All data will be available to all researchers.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: All data will be available to all researchers once related papers have been accepted publicly, and will be available for ever.
